lines.text: The only thing that burns in Hell is the part of you that won't let go of life, your memories, your attachments. They burn them all away. But they're not punishing you, he said. They're freeing your soul. So the way he sees it, if you're frightened of dying and... and you're holding on, you'll see devils tearing your life away. But if you've made your peace, then the devils are really angels, freeing you from the earth. It's just a matter of how you look at it, that's all. So don't worry, okay? Okay?

[reading Jacob's palm]
See. According to this, you're already dead.
You're a lucky guy, Jake. You must have friends in high places.
Jezzie? Get me out of here.
Where do you want to go?
Home? This is your home. You're dead.
Dead? No. I just hurt my back, I'm not dead.
Then what are you doing here?
There is no out of here. You've been killed, don't you remember?
Mr. Singer. What an appropriate name for a man who can't shut up.

[Reading the thermometer]
Oh my God! I'm calling the Doctor!

[On the phone]
Hello Dr. Forest! I'm so sorry to bother you! This is Jezzie Pimpkin up in 14G! I just took Jake's temperature and it's up to 106, could that be right?Oh my God!
[gets off the phone and starts running a bath]
Well, personally, I never went for church names.
Where do you think Jezebel came from?
You're such a heathen, Jezzie. How'd I ever get involved with such a fuckin' ninny?
You sold your soul, remember? That's what you told me.
I'd only been in jail 13 hours, I thought 'Nam couldn't be any worse.
You know you look like an angel, Louie? Like an overgrown cherub. Anyone ever tell you that?

[smiling]
Yeah, you. Every time you see me.

[holding a crucifix and a bible]
Look, I carry these around everywhere with me but they don't help.
Jake, New York is filled with creatures.
Well, you've done it to yourself this time, haven't you?
From a slipped disk? That'll be a first.
